thread.title: 45 People Were Injured after Violent Clashes between Fans during a Derby Game in DR Congo
thread.title_full: 45 People Were Injured after Violent Clashes between Fans during a Derby Game in DR Congo | Complex UK

author: Corey Pellatt
title: 45 People Were Injured after Violent Clashes between Fans during a Derby Game in DR Congo
text:
Fan violence is still a problem in the Democratic Republic of Congo .
Last weekend, one of the tensest matches in African club football took place when Vita Club faced off with Daring Club Motema Pembe in the Kinshasa derby. The two teams are among the most successful in DR Congo and in 1984, a match between the two sides lasted just three minutes before fan disturbances took hold.
This year, chaos erupted when Motema Pembe took the lead, which prompted multiple fan invasions from both teams. According to reports, up to 45 people were injured the violence but there were no fatalities.
Last year, 14 people died during a stampede at a football match in Kinshasa.
This 50-year-old rivalry makes El Clasico look friendly.
[via 101 Great Goals ]
